                 Core and developmental 
                 actions
                 The NSQHS Standards apply to a wide variety 
                 of health service organisations. Due to the 
                 variable size, structure and complexity of health 
                 service delivery models, a degree of lfexibility is 
                 required in the application of the standards. 
                 To achieve this lfexibility, each action within a 
                 Standard is designated as either:
                     CORE
                     –  considered fundamental to safe practice
                 OR
                     DEVELOPMENTAL
                     –  areas where health service organisations 
                        can focus activities or investments that 
                        improve patient safety and quality.
                 Information about which actions have been 
                 designated as core or developmental is 
                 available on the Commission’s web site.

                                                                                  Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching  |  5
           Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching
           Standard 5: 
           Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching
           Clinical leaders and senior managers of a health service 
           organisation establish systems to ensure the correct identiifcation 
           of patients and correct matching of patients with their intended 
           treatment. Clinicians and other members of the workforce use the 
           patient identiifcation and procedure matching systems.
           The intention of this Standard is to:                           Implementing systems to ensure 
           Correctly identify all patients whenever care is provided       correct patient identiifcation and 
           and correctly match patients to their intended treatment.       procedure matching
                                                                           Since patient identiifcation is an activity that is 
           Context:                                                        performed frequently, it can often be seen as 
           It is expected that this Standard will be applied in            a relatively unimportant task. It is important to 
           conjunction with Standard 1: Governance for Safety              take human factors into account when planning 
           and Quality in Health Service Organisations and                 patient safety, to emphasise the design of systems 
           Standard 2: Partnering with Consumers.                          that consider human capabilities, limitations and

                                                                           characteristics. The development of safety routines

                                                                           provides a powerful defence against simple mistakes

       6  |  Australian Commission on Safety and Quality in Health Care 
            Criteria to achieve the Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching Standard:
            Identiifcation of individual patients
               At least three approved patient identiifers are used when providing care, therapy or services.
            Processes to transfer care
               A patient’s identity is conifrmed using three approved identiifers when transferring responsibility for care. 
            Processes to match patients and their care
               Health service organisations have explicit processes to correctly match patients with their intended care.
           For the purposes of accreditation, please check the Commission’s web site regarding actions within these criteria 
           that have been designated as core or developmental.

                                                               Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                                               5.2 I mplementing a robust organisation-wide system of reporting, investigation and 
                                                                                     change management to respond to any patient care mismatching events
                                                               5.2.1 The system                                                                                                 Key task:
                                                               for reporting,                                                                                                   •	            Establish or adapt an incident reporting system that captures data on patient 
                                                               investigating and                                                                                                              mismatching events and near misses
                                                               analysis of patient 
                                                               care mismatching                                                                                                 Suggested strategies:
                                                               events is regularly                                                                                              Systems for reporting, investigation and analysis of patient identiifcation mismatching 
                                                               monitored                                                                                                        events are one part of a broader incident management system. Item 1.14 of Standard 1  :
                                                                                                                                                                                Governance for Safety and Quality in Health Service Organisations outlines the actions 
                                                                                                                                                                                required to implement an incident management and investigation system. Implementation 
                                                                                                                                                                                of systems to meet Item 1.14 enables the effective reporting, investigation and analysis of 
                                                                                                                                                                                patient care mismatching events. 
                                                                                                                                                                                You should review patient mismatching incidents, adverse events and near misses 
                                                                                                                                                                                to enable identiifcation of failures to comply with policies, procedures and protocols, 
                                                                                                                                                                                failures of implementation of policies, or the need to revise policies.
                                                                                                                                                                                You should monitor the effectiveness of the system for reporting, investigating and 
                                                                                                                                                                                analysing patient care mismatching events, including assessment of: 
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            reporting rates over time (note that reporting rates should not be interpreted 
                                                                                                                                                                                              as the rate of incidence – they may increase as a successful reporting culture 
                                                                                                                                                                                              becomes established)
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            uptake of recommendations stemming from any investigations into any patient care 
                                                                                                                                                                                              mismatching events.
                                                                                                                                                                                Outputs of improvement processes may include:
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            reports from incident reporting systems
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            documents from the investigation of serious mismatching events.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching  |  13
                                                                             Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching
                                   Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                   5.2 I mplementing a robust organisation-wide system of reporting, investigation and 
                                                        change management to respond to any patient care mismatching events                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    (continued)
                                   5.2.2 Action is                                                                                                  Key tasks:
                                   taken to reduce                                                                                                  •	            Use the data from the incident reporting system to recommend and prioritise 
                                   mismatching events                                                                                                             quality improvement activities
                                                                                                                                                    •	            Review data and risks of mismatching events and near misses and develop 
                                                                                                                                                                  strategies for reducing the likelihood of these events
                                                                                                                                                    •	            Communicate to the workforce the results of investigations into mismatching 
                                                                                                                                                                  events and any resulting changes to policy, procedure or protocols
                                                                                                                                                    Suggested strategies:
                                                                                                                                                    Note: The strategies outlined in Actions 5.1.1 and 5.1.2 also apply to this action.
                                                                                                                                                    You should ensure that all members of the workforce who are involved in identiifcation 
                                                                                                                                                    and matching processes receive training and updates about:
                                                                                                                                                    •	            their roles, responsibilities and accountabilities as participants in the patient 
                                                                                                                                                                  identiifcation and matching process
                                                                                                                                                    •	            the policies, procedures and protocols for matching a patient’s identity to their 
                                                                                                                                                                  intended procedure, treatment or investigation
                                                                                                                                                    •	            relevant data from audit and reporting systems and the recommendations from 
                                                                                                                                                                  any investigations into mismatching events
                                                                                                                                                    •	            the importance of, and process for, reporting mismatching events 
                                                                                                                                                    •	            when and how to use the reporting system. 
                                                                                                                                                    Speciifc actions required to reduce mismatching events may vary depending on the root 
                                                                                                                                                    cause of any errors or near misses that occur. You should develop local strategies for 
                                                                                                                                                    improvement in response to analysis of local data. Strategies may include:
                                                                                                                                                    •	            introduction of forcing functions or critical stops to ensure correct patient identiifcation
                                                                                                                                                    •	            orientation, training and education
                                                                                                                                                    •	            changes to the policies, procedures and protocols for ensuring correct 
                                                                                                                                                                  patient identiifcation
                                                                                                                                                    •	            changes to the policy supporting correct patient identiifcation
                                                                                                                                                    •	            investigation of mismatching events and near misses and implementation 
                                                                                                                                                                  of subsequent recommendations.
                                                                                                                                                    Outputs of improvement processes may include:
                                                                                                                                                    •	            education and training programs and evidence of the application of the training
                                                                                                                                                    •	            documents describing the process and outcomes of relevant quality 
                                                                                                                                                                  improvement activities
                                                                                                                                                    •	            workforce feedback and communication strategies that provide information about the 
                                                                                                                                                                  patient identiifcation matching process, the reporting system, and relevant audit data 
                                                                                                                                                                  and recommendations from any investigations into mismatching events
                                                                                                                                                    •	            action taken at both a local and organisational level in response to recommendations 
                                                                                                                                                                  stemming from the investigation of patient mismatching events or near misses.
                             14  |  Australian Commission on Safety and Quality in Health Care 
                                                               Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                                               5.3 E  nsuring that when a patient identiifcation band is used, it meets the national 
                                                                                     speciifcations for patient identiifcation bands
                                                               5.3.1 Inpatient                                                                                                  Key task:
                                                               bands are used                                                                                                   •	            Introduce and/or conifrm that the identiifcation bands used in your organisation 
                                                               that meet the                                                                                                                  meet the national speciifcations for patient identiifcation bands
                                                               national speciifcations 
                                                               for patient                                                                                                      Suggested strategies:
                                                               identiifcation bands                                                                                             The primary use of patient identiifcation bands is to identify patients when care, 
                                                                                                                                                                                therapy or services are provided. They are most commonly used in inpatient settings. 
                                                                                                                                                                                The Speciifcations for a Standard Patient Identiifcation Band (see Appendix B) and an 
                                                                                                                                                                                accompanying fact sheet and Frequently Asked Questions can be downloaded from 
                                                                                                                                                                                the Commission’s web site. You should use these to ensure that the patient identiifcation 
                                                                                                                                                                                bands used by your organisation are standardised and comply with the speciifcations. 
                                                                                                                                                                                These resources are available from:
                                                                                                                                                                                www.safetyandquality.gov.au/our-work/patient-identiifcation/a-national-standard-for-
                                                                                                                                                                                patient-identiifcation-bands-in-australia/
                                                                                                                                                                                The speciifcations apply to bands that have the primary purpose of identifying the patient 
                                                                                                                                                                                within the health service organisation. They do not apply to bands or bracelets that have 
                                                                                                                                                                                other purposes (such as triggering an alarm when a patient leaves a certain area).
                                                                                                                                                                                Neither the NSQHS Standards nor the speciifcations require all people receiving care in 
                                                                                                                                                                                a health service organisation to wear identiifcation bands. The organisation-wide system 
                                                                                                                                                                                for patient identiifcation and procedure matching should identify when such bands need 
                                                                                                                                                                                to be used, and what arrangements are in place for maintaining and checking identify for 
                                                                                                                                                                                people who do not wear bands.
                                                                                                                                                                                The Commission does not recommend that identiifcation bands vary from the 
                                                                                                                                                                                speciifcations. If it considered absolutely necessary to use a band that is different 
                                                                                                                                                                                from the speciifcations (for example, one that includes additional data items), these 
                                                                                                                                                                                changes should be considered within a risk management framework. The speciifcations 
                                                                                                                                                                                were developed to minimise adverse events associated with patient identiifcation and 
                                                                                                                                                                                procedure matching, and using identiifcation bands that do not comply with them 
                                                                                                                                                                                may increase the risk of such events occurring. You should assess the potential risks 
                                                                                                                                                                                associated with any proposed changes, identify strategies to ameliorate these risks, 
                                                                                                                                                                                and document this process.
                                                                                                                                                                                You should conduct regular audits to monitor the proportion of identiifcation bands 
                                                                                                                                                                                in use that meet the national speciifcations.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching  |  15

                                   Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                   5.3 E  nsuring that when a patient identiifcation band is used, it meets the national 
                                                        speciifcations for patient identiifcation bands                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       (continued)
                                   (continued)                                                                                                      Note: The Commission does not recommend the use of coloured bands to alert 
                                   5.3.1 Inpatient                                                                                                  clinicians to speciifc clinical information such as falls risk, allergies or resuscitation status. 
                                                                                                                                                    The use of colour-coded bands to indicate clinical risk is based on tradition rather than 
                                   bands are used                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    12-13
                                                                                                                                                    evidence of any patient safety beneift.                                                                                                                                         Inconsistencies in the meaning attached to the 
                                   that meet the                                                                                                    various colours of band in different hospitals can lead to confusion and error, particularly 
                                   national speciifcations                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              14-16
                                                                                                                                                    when the workforce works across different health service organisations.  In one 
                                   for patient                                                                                                      Australian state it was found that over 60 different types of identiifcation and alert bands 
                                   identiifcation bands                                                                                             were in use, and there was signiifcant variation in the type of risk indicated by a particular 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    17
                                                                                                                                                    colour of band.
                                                                                                                                                    Problems have also been identiifed with ensuring that the information conveyed by a 
                                                                                                                                                    coloured band accurately relfects the patient’s clinical situation and is synchronised with 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  12
                                                                                                                                                    the patient record.  Incorrect or out-of-date bands can have tragic consequences for 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          14

                                                                                                                                                    You should use a multi-factorial approach for the management of clinical risk for 
                                                                                                                                                    patients with speciifc characteristics or conditions. The Commission recommends that 
                                                                                                                                                    if a risk alert band is deemed absolutely necessary, then only a red band be used with 
                                                                                                                                                    information regarding the speciifc nature of the risk documented in the patient record.

                                                                                                                                                    •	            evidence that inpatient bands are regularly checked for compliance with the national 
                                                                                                                                                                  speciifcations for patient identiifcation bands.
                             16  |  Australian Commission on Safety and Quality in Health Care 
                                 Standard 5 
                                 Criterion: Processes to transfer care
                                 A patient’s identity is conifrmed using three 
                                 approved patient identiifers when transferring 
                                 responsibility for care 
                                 Transfer of responsibility for a patient’s care occurs frequently in health care. 
                                 This includes at changes of medical and nursing shifts, and when care is transferred to 
                                 another health facility, primary care practitioner, or medical ofifcer. Breakdowns in the 
                                 transfer of information during transfer of care are a major preventable cause of patient 
                                       18
                                 harm.  Standard 6: Clinical Handover requires organisations to implement systems for 
                                 structured clinical handover – it is important that the requirements for conifrming patient 
                                 identiifcation are considered when developing these systems.
                                                                                      Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching  |  17

                                                                                  Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching  |  19
                                                                             Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching
                                   Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                   5.5  Developing and implementing a documented process to match patients 
                                                        to their intended procedure, treatment or investigation and implementing 
                                                        the consistent national guidelines for patient procedure matching protocol 
                                                        or other relevant protocols
                                   5.5.1 A documented                                                                                               Key task:
                                   process to match                                                                                                 •	            Develop explicit, documented protocols to outline the process of matching 
                                   patients and their                                                                                                             a patient to their intended treatment 
                                   intended treatment 
                                   is in use                                                                                                        Suggested strategies:
                                                                                                                                                    You should incorporate structured patient/procedure matching protocols into your 
                                                                                                                                                    organisation-wide patient identiifcation system and use these protocols to ensure that 
                                                                                                                                                    the right patients receive the right care. The original focus for efforts to correctly match 
                                                                                                                                                    patients to the correct procedure was in surgery; however there is now a wider range 
                                                                                                                                                    of protocols available that address the speciifc needs of other speciality areas.
                                                                                                                                                    The Commission has developed a set of patient matching protocols for speciifc 
                                                                                                                                                    therapeutic and diagnostic areas such as surgery, nuclear medicine and radiation 
                                                                                                                                                    therapy. The protocols are available for download from:
                                                                                                                                                    www.safetyandquality.gov.au/our-work/patient-identiifcation/enhancinensuring-
                                                                                                                                                    correct-patient-correct-site-correct-procedure-protocol/
                                                                                                                                                    www.safetyandquality.gov.au/our-work/patient-identiifcation/expanding-the-3cs-into-
                                                                                                                                                    other-therapeutic-areas/
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             19
                                                                                                                                                    The WHO surgical safety checklist has been demonstrated to improve patient safety
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                    and is now widely used in Australia. This checklist includes elements relating to 
                                                                                                                                                    patient identiifcation and procedure matching and if it is in place in your health service 
                                                                                                                                                    organisation it can be used as the patient/procedure matching protocol. 
                                                                                                                                                    The surgical safety checklist and implementation manual can be downloaded from:
                                                                                                                                                    www.who.int/patientsafety/safesurgery/ss_checklist/en/
                                                                                                                                                    The Australia and New Zealand edition of the surgical safety checklist can be 
                                                                                                                                                    downloaded from:
                                                                                                                                                    www.surgeons.org/media/12661/LST_2009_Surgical_Safety_Check_
                                                                                                                                                    List_%28Australia_and_New_Zealand%29.pdf
                                                                                                                                                    The key steps that underlie all of these protocols of care are:
                                                                                                                                                    •	            if necessary, mark the site of the procedure
                                                                                                                                                    •	            verify the identity of the patient
                                                                                                                                                    •	            verify the details of the procedure being undertaken, including the site 
                                                                                                                                                                  of the procedure
                                                                                                                                                    •	            take a time out or similar stop with all members of the team to do a ifnal 
                                                                                                                                                                  check before the procedure commences
                                                                                                                                                    •	            conifrm all documentation, samples and other information and materials 
                                                                                                                                                                  following completion of the procedure.
                                                                                                                                                    To develop protocols for other clinical situations, involve those with local knowledge 
                                                                                                                                                    of the process to adapt the patient identiifcation and procedure matching protocols for 
                                                                                                                                                    their speciifc requirements. When deciding what clinical areas should have their own 
                                                                                                                                                    speciifc patient/procedure matching protocol, you should focus on areas of higher risk 
                                                                                                                                                    for patients and your health service organisation.
                                                                                                                                                    Outputs of improvement processes may include:
                                                                                                                                                    •	            protocols for patient identiifcation and procedure matching for different clinical situations
                                                                                                                                                    •	            communication material for the workforce on procedure matching requirements.
                             20  |  Australian Commission on Safety and Quality in Health Care 
                                                               Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                                               5.5  Developing and implementing a documented process to match patients 
                                                                                     to their intended procedure, treatment or investigation and implementing 
                                                                                     the consistent national guidelines for patient procedure matching protocol 
                                                                                     or other relevant protocols                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           (continued)
                                                               5.5.2 The process                                                                                                Key task:
                                                               to match patients                                                                                                •	            Incorporate process measures that will identify if the patient identiifcation 
                                                               to any intended                                                                                                                matching system is in use and working effectively into your monitoring system 
                                                               procedure, treatment                                                                                                           for the organisation-wide patient identiifcation system (see Action 5.1.2)
                                                               or investigation is 
                                                               regularly monitored                                                                                              Suggested strategies:
                                                                                                                                                                                You should include audit of compliance with the patient/procedure matching 
                                                                                                                                                                                protocols in the evaluation plan developed as part of your organisation-wide patient 
                                                                                                                                                                                identiifcation system. 
                                                                                                                                                                                Process measures that will assist in identifying whether the patient identiifcation and 
                                                                                                                                                                                matching system is being used effectively may include:
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            observational audit of particular practice episodes, e.g. admission or registration 
                                                                                                                                                                                              procedures; medication rounds; radiology matching procedures; surgical procedures
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            audit of documentation that is used as part of patient matching procedures, 
                                                                                                                                                                                              for example, checklists or clinical pathways.
                                                                                                                                                                                Outputs of improvement processes may include:
                                                                                                                                                                                •	            data from the audit of patient identiifcation and procedure matching processes.

                                                                             Standard 5: Patient Identiifcation and Procedure Matching
                                   Actions required                                                                                                 Implementation strategies
                                   5.5  Developing and implementing a documented process to match patients 
                                                        to their intended procedure, treatment or investigation and implementing 
                                                        the consistent national guidelines for patient procedure matching protocol 
                                                        or other relevant protocols                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           (continued)
                                   5.5.3 Action is                                                                                                  Key tasks:
                                   taken to improve                                                                                                 •	            Introduce or conifrm the use of speciifc, localised strategies for improvement 
                                   the effectiveness                                                                                                              based on the results of audit of local practices
                                   of the process for                                                                                               •	            Communicate to the workforce the results of audit into the patient matching 
                                   matching patients                                                                                                              process and any resulting changes to policy, procedure or protocols 
                                   to their intended 
                                   procedure, treatment                                                                                             Suggested strategies:
                                   or investigation                                                                                                 Note: the strategies outlined in Actions 5.1.1, 5.1.2 and 5.2.2 are also applicable 
                                                                                                                                                    to this action.
                                                                                                                                                    Speciifc actions required to improve the effectiveness of the process for matching 
                                                                                                                                                    patients to their intended procedure, treatment or investigation may vary depending 
                                                                                                                                                    on the areas for improvement that are identiifed through audit data. You should develop 
                                                                                                                                                    local strategies for improvement in response to analysis of local data. These strategies 
                                                                                                                                                    may include: 
                                                                                                                                                    •	            introduction of forcing functions or critical stops to patient/procedure 
                                                                                                                                                                  matching protocols
                                                                                                                                                    •	            orientation, training and education about using the procotcols for matching patients 
                                                                                                                                                                  to their intended care
                                                                                                                                                    •	            changes to policies, procedures and protocols 
                                                                                                                                                    •	            investigation of mismatching events and implementation of subsequent 
                                                                                                                                                                  recommendations
                                                                                                                                                    •	            reporting of incidents and cases where mismatches were averted through positive 
                                                                                                                                                                  checking procedures.
                                                                                                                                                    Outputs of improvement processes may include:
                                                                                                                                                    •	            orientation, training and education programs and evidence of the application 
                                                                                                                                                                  of the training
                                                                                                                                                    •	            documents describing the process and outcomes of relevant quality 
                                                                                                                                                                  improvement activities
                                                                                                                                                    •	            material for the workforce that provides information about the patient 
                                                                                                                                                                  identiifcation matching process, the reporting system, and relevant audit 
                                                                                                                                                                  data and recommendations from any investigations into mismatching events.
